intro: Disporum ovale var. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower deathcamis, is a striking plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has arrow-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
